description: this is the identifier for the start of the ZEUS0001 UDP packet
the length of the packet (not including all characters up-to the comma which follows this number)
the valid time for this packet
indication of whether the unit is successfully synchronised to NTP time ( 1 = synced, 0 = not-synced )
indicates the flight number for this packet ( an "XXXX" string here indicates that the unit hasn't been assigned a flight number )
indicates whether the realtime code is running ( a value toggling e.g. 1-0-1-0?etc shows running code, fixed value = non running )
this number starts @ zero and increments with each UDP packet - used for verification of packet stream
a string to represent the percentage of SD card currently free
1Hz raw readings (in counts) taken from the Field mill sensor
to account for an erroneous field at the end of packet
